Reviews.Title: “a little bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: and7673
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a room of the row facing 101 road. it's a little bit noisy there. Closestool has a terrible noise. other is OK. the breakfast is in a Japanese restaurant nearby, which provides turkey ham.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at affordable price”
Reviews.Author: KSquaredNYC
Reviews.Content: Our friend recommended the Mikado. It was a very nice basic hotel, everything was very clean. The free breakfast was a nice perk, and there was a microwave & fridge in the room which was very useful. Our balcony overlooked a pretty Japanese garden. My only complaint was the noise. Whenever the rooms next to (or below) us took a shower this strange hissing in the pipes would wake us up since it was quite loud, and everyone seemed to shower at 4 am! LOL But we did NOT hear any voices or other typical hotel noises from the room next door. We also did not hear the traffic at all even though our room was facing the main street. (we were on the 2nd floor, which reminds me there was no elevator but there was a wheelchair lift attached to the stairs if you need it) We stayed for 4 nights, and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff, convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: newvision
Reviews.Content: I was pleased this hotel suited my needs for work. the room had a good desk area, free wifi, and a Japanese restaurant attached, which was of very good standard, whether sushi bar or table service. Noise was a problem the Saturday night with a party, carrying on loudly.The rooms face onto a courtyard.... So my ear plugs came in handy! For work I needed to be close to Dinair- 53 Canyon Blvd, so chose this hotel as it was the closest-a 1.6 miles walk. As I had no idea where it was, Ruella in reception kindly found this out, and drew me a mud map, allaying my concerns, for the next days workshop. I walked it, but elected to get $7US taxi there (which she rang for me) in the mornings, but nice long walk back if I wished. All in all, a good choice for my needs and I booked through Webjet Hotels using their discount savings and got $78. off.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a plus hotel”
Reviews.Author: R H
Reviews.Content: Our family got a room, dropped off some items in it and went to our car to get more items. We had to park a ways off from the room since there was no front area parking. We got back to the room and there was a guy in it. It turned out the hotel clerk gave us keys for another customer's room. Our room was the one next to the man's room. Our room was clean, but the bathroom layout was awful. The bathroom door verily closed with 1/4" or less door to toilette gap when closing door. The bathroom had some weird wood add on to the bathroom sink that took space and made the bathroom look even weirder. Hardly any parking in the front and if you got a room in the front you had to park in the back because of the restaurant customers. One night I got back to the hotel after 9 pm with my wife and kids and we had to park on the back. The back door that led to the lobby or to the area that ed to my room was locked. A little sign on it stated the door got locked at 9 pm. We had to walk all the way around the hotel to get to our room. This was not nice on a cold and rainy night. The jacuzzi did not heat up. When I complained about the door and jacuzzi I was given a hotel review form. I'm not sure that they really cared about my complaint.

Reviews.Title: “The worst Hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: Maninky
Reviews.Content: My family and I were visiting Universal Studios Hollywood and my husband booked this place threw hotel's.com the pictures are very misleading on the Internet. The rooms seemed pretty decent in the photos but we were unpleasantly surprised! The place had glass shutter window leading to the balcony 2 of the glasses were compleatly missing. The carpet was filthy it seemed like it had not been cleaned in years found several open staples and hair on the carpet. The bathroom sink had hairs in it. The lamp covers were so dusty! My whole family started itching all over non stop! This place is so old and nasty I don't know why it has any good reviews at all! Thankfully we checked out that same night. FYI don't book threw Hotels. Com they have the worst customer service ever! Spent more than 3.5 hrs trying to get them to change our hotel with no luck!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, reasonably priced, adequate room”
Reviews.Author: EthelMertz1115
Reviews.Content: Either the construction was done or we were just lucky on a Friday night/Saturday morning, but we had no problems with loud noise. The location is great, just off of the 101, but not so close that you hear the cars. It's also close to good restaurants and shopping and Universal but you didn't have to pay an arm and a leg for your room. The room is a reasonable size, clean, and comfortable. The guy at the front desk was friendly and accommodating. It was too late and chilly to use the pool, but the area looked inviting and not so small that you'd be bumping into folks if you used it. My only complaint was entrance into the hotel from the back parking area was down a steep flight of stairs that was difficult for my elderly mother to handle. I don't think they had any handicapped accessible rooms either.

Reviews.Title: “50th percentile”
Reviews.Author: KommissarKen
Reviews.Content: The best part of this property is the swimming pool and hot tub. Downsides include a breakfast buffet in a building separate from the hotel (without the ability to take a tray back to your room) and rather strange access to one's room from the lobby, especially later in the evening. But it is adequate as a place to stay on the north side of L.A.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: soxrock
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when we visited family and it was very close. There were no major hotels in the area. The rate was reasonable and the room was clean. The room was small, especially the bathroom. I finally figured out the flow of the shower on the last day, because it was usually a trickle. The bed was comfortable. The breakfast could use some improvement, the healthy items (fruit) could have been better. All said in done, it was a room.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, clean motel offers great breakfasts!”
Reviews.Author: ellynvb
Reviews.Content: We stay here when we visit family in Valley Village and have found it to be cozy, clean with good service, and this recent trip Aug 2011 was no exception. Reasonably sized rooms with comfortable bed and pillows that are not too squishy, full mini fridge (including freezer), a nice pool. Attached is the Mikado restaurant which offers a full lovely breakfast (free) and is available for sensational Japanese food for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: dolphinmaniac
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for our part of collage trip. Hotel was very close Hollywood and universal city. If you have a car there is no problem. There were some shopping places and whole foods market around very close. We we got there around 1 pm, our room wasn't ready which was understandable. The person at the reception desk was not helpful. We requested to leave our car there and go to downtown while we were waiting for our room. We asked him some maps and information brochure about the city. He just pointed some place and went on talking on the phone. He was continuously talking the phone and never tried to help us. He even didn't smile or show any empathy. The internet wasn't working and he didn't care or help with it. At the end , we used our laptop and figured some information from internet. When we decided to go , he called us that the room was ready. I thought it was already ready, he was just enjoying our waiting. There wasn't any map or any information other than sightseeing tours. Breakfast was OK. Eating breakfast on the tables looking to the pool in the morning was a good start.

Reviews.Title: “My Birthday Vacation for 6 nights : )~”
Reviews.Author: Sirlegit
Reviews.Content: Room #137 *Very Friendly & Helpful Staff at the front desk, A good location within 20 miles Of tourist locations, Beach, Shops, stores , resturants going North, South, East and West , The internet was working pretty good , a very nice old skoo lounge . *Very , very Comfortable Mattress and Pillow, Room always clean, housekeepers are good, even when they have a sign says if you want to recycle our towels , hang them up , We had our towels hung up most of the time, and they still give us fresh ones .... *Breakfast was good , its almost like a buffet type setting, they had waffles, eggs, turkey link , potatoes, bacon and the rest pastries and cereal ,The lady server was really friendly and thoughtful , we came alittle late , she still went to get more food to put out there : ) Thank you , I forgot to leave a tip they really deserve it, But you get a good bargain by saving alot of money on breakfast and being how the room was a reasonable rate. Now far as Mikado resturant , we never ate there but the resturant will give you 10 % off if you stayed at that Hotel *Hotel looks clean everywhere, nice landscape , the Pool looked really nice, never had time to get in and the hot tub was nice at the end of the night wish the hours was longer for it to stay open , but either way it goes Me and my wife had a really good night sleep... * Parking is free , not a big parking lot considering the Resturant is connected to , if you planning on staynig out late after 10 p.m, Expect to have a differcult time finding a parking space , where you would trust it , If you don't want to park it in the back , the only option would be on the Street , even though there is alittle more traffic going on ........ *When traveling to LA will definitely stay at this hotel !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Iris C.
Reviews.Content: This little motel was a great surprise. Woderful service, great free hot breakfast in the japanese restaurant with actual dishes, no paper plates or cups. Lovely residential neighborhood. Very quiet. Definitely stay again as it was the most reasonably priced motel I found on the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, Asian-inspired Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TRTW
Reviews.Content: I decided to choose BW Mikado because of a previous stay that was quite pleasant. Again, the hotel proved it was worth staying at again. Check in was prompt. The gentleman at the front counter anticipated my arrival and the keys/room were ready. The lobby was classy - it has a grand piano! Upon arriving at the room, I noticed how clean and modern it looked. As always, the room was comfortable. Internet connection was fast, enjoyed the private balcony, and the view from the room. There's a Japanese garden in the middle of the hotel. The red bridge stood out. The hotel also offered free continental breakfast located at the restaurant next door. I will definitely come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in LA Area”
Reviews.Author: CaspianSeal
Reviews.Content: I've been to this hotel for years and this last time I stayed was a pleasant surprise. Same pleasant staff, but brand new rooms with new furniture, new TVs, and upgraded bathrooms. Bathrooms are still on the smaller side, but they're at least new. It could use a fitness room, but it has a swimming pool and whirl pool. But, you can't go wrong with having a sushi bar/lounge in the hotel and not to mention full complementary breakfast in the mornings. Still the best value in the Studio City area. Oh, and it's still got the Japanese bonzai garden with the red bridge over the pond with koi and goldfish.

Reviews.Title: “This place is horrible”
Reviews.Author: Googie_5
Reviews.Content: The carpet is filthy and grimy, the rooms are so so old and they smell horrible, and to make it even worse, the man at the front desk is extremely rude and unhelpful. They have these tiny, lumpy pillows. My husband called asking for an extra pillow and the man at reception told him they don't have any and he should roll up a blanket and use that. Most of the hotel was empty so they could easily of gotton one from an empty room! Don't ever stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Peregrina651
Reviews.Content: The Best Western Mikado was perfect for us. Besides the fact it that was a five minute walk to our son's apartment (and how often do you get that lucky in LA), we found the hotel to be clean and well kept and the front desk staff to be helpful even if a bit reserved. Keeping in mind that we are talking about a mid-range hotel chain and not the Ritz, our room spacious and internet access was free even in the rooms (and I can't say that about the convention hotel we stayed in for the rest of our stay). The hotel breakfast buffet was hot and hearty and we felt comfortable and safe in the neighborhood. Provided my son is still living in the neighborhood on our next visit, we will stay here again; it was just right for us. All the good stuff said, I must warn you that if you can't deal with street/city noise, this hotel is not for you. It is not a quiet location with the 101 freeway right out the back door and a major through-street out the front. While it didn't bother us, there are those for whom it is an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Professional Staff, Clean but a Few Problems”
Reviews.Author: akidcagal
Reviews.Content: This is a nicely kept up property. The japenese garden theme is done nicely. There is even a bridge over water with goldfish and a couple of small KOI in it. It is also nicely landscaped. The pool was sparkling and big. It also was 11 feet deep in the deep end. Diving possible! The breakfast was great. They have a Japanese restaurant on site which is very high end and expensive so we did not eat there. However, in the morning they use the same restaurant to serve a complimentary hot buffet breakfast complete with potatoes, scrambled eggs, bacon, turkey sausage, waffles not to mention all the usual continental breakfast items like toast, cereal, fruit and pastries. Definitely a nice place to eat breakfast with big, oversized leather booths and tablecloths. There is also a nice patio you can eat on. The room was clean but cramped feeling in the closet and bathroom area. The bathroom was definitely the worst aspect of the room. The sink is sandwiched between the toilet and the bathtub/shower. There is a tiny counter area around the sink and an 8" or so strip of counter behind the toilet. If you have something up there and it falls, guess where it falls into? If you are on the toilet and someone tries to open the door, you get bumped by the door completely. There is no room to spare in this bathroom. And it is a one at a time bathroom as no one can use the sink without interrupting someone showering or on the toilet. I thought there was only 2 towels so I went and got two more from the pleasant desk clerk. Then, while taking a shower, I noticed the towel rack in the shower at the end of the bathtub way up high that had the two missing towels on it. I will have to say, though, that the towels are very thick and BIG. However, they do not have "pool towels" so you have to use the same ones. The plumbing gets a "D" in this property. The shower head's adjustment was broken so you only had a whimpy stream of water. Also you could not have the water all the way in the shower so water was also coming out of the bathtub spigot at the same time because that pull out knob would not pull out all the way. Also the sink knobs turn in different directions so it makes it confusing to turn the water on and off. The plumbing is loud. We were watching TV and heard a weird high pitched sound. We thought it was the TV but if turns out it was the sound of the pipes through the wall as someone else in another room was probably showering. The beds are full (double sized) which made it a bit tight for 4 people (2 adults and two children) The TV was in a beautiful Armoire and the room had a microwave and fridge. The freeway is right in back of the hotel. We were in an inside facing room so the noise was not too bad but it must be horrible to be on the backside by the freeway though. Since the room was clean, the staff was professional , the breakfast was good and the pool and hot tub were sparkling, this is an acceptable place to stay. However, it is not without its flaws but I really don't think we could have done much better in the area. We once stayed at the Universal Sheraton and that place was not impressive either at double the price of this one. Whereas some aspects of this hotel rate at an A+, others are about a D- so this place gets about a "C" from me.

Reviews.Title: “Dated, damp, smelly”
Reviews.Author: lovetojourney
Reviews.Content: We were stuck at this motel for 3 days. Unfortunately we had no choice as we had to be within walking distance of family in North Hollywood (long story). The postion was good for us in that respect. However the motel is situated between a busy road and the Ventura Freeway, so the position should never be good for anyone else! Thankfully the constant traffic noise was drowned out by the noisy airconditioner. This place really needs to be stripped down & completely renovated. The adjoining rooms we had on the ground floor overlooked the nice pool which in turn was overlooked by the carpark and the road (NO privacy whatsoever). The rooms each had 2 double beds which were actually very comfortable. The sheets & towels were clean and replaced daily. The maids did a good job with the limited facilities. Last decorated in the 1960's when dark decor and smoking was fashionable, the supposedly non-smoking rooms stunk and one room had permanently wet carpet outside the bathroom door. All our clothes had to be washed when we finally left this place - so bad was the revolting smokey & damp smell. We arrived early after a 14 hour flight from Australia. The rooms weren't ready yet so the Manager kindly invited us to have breakfast while we waited. Breakfast is included in the room rate and was totally inedible. I spat out the rubbery waffle, the hot food looked as if it had been there for weeks. We avoided any further breakfast there. The Manager was not surprised when we complained about the smell and the wet carpet. He claimed he was unable to move us (perhaps there was nowhere better??) but did reduce the quoted rate which was only fair. A couple of good things - there was a fridge, microwave & coffee maker in the room (necessary for making our own edible breakfast!) and the wireless internet was efficient and free. Best Western should be ashamed of this place. It MUST be closed for a complete renovation immediately. Stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Police action”
Reviews.Author: JimGL
Reviews.Content: Was in LA area shooting for a book project and traveling with my two work associates(assistant and stylist). Booked into the Best Western Mikado because we had a few days of shooting on location very close to this motel in Studio City. The motel was clean and the staff friendly, not a great place but not a bad place but seemed a good value for the room charge. The third day we arrived back from shooting probably at 6pm or so and there were 5 police cars parked both in the lot and on the Riverside Drive. We slowly pulled into the small parking lot past the police who were in the process of handcuffing a few guys and a woman. Went to the front desk where nearby was a man sitting down and a police officer. I asked the front desk person what was up with the police action and he did not offer any info but the guy sitting heard my question and said he had come here for a "casual encounter" with a woman he contacted online thru Craig's List and once in the room was jumped by 4 men. We checked out immediately and there was no refund offered. Went to the Courtyard by Marriott in Pasadena. Guess the caution I would offer is that any "motel" in or near the San Fernando Valley --or anywhere for that matter--might be less secure than a hotel where guests have to walk thru the front lobby to get to their room. The Courtyard was a better value---and for just $20 more a night per room--and it offered a better sense of security.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: degustibusnon
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel many times as it is convenient to family who live nearby. The rooms are comfortable, with good bedding, microwave, table and chairs. Bathrooms a little small but water pressure is good and hot water abundant. One of the nicest features of the hotel is that breakfast at the nearby Mikado Restaurant is included in the room price, and it's a good breakfast. Scrambled and hard-boiled eggs, various breads, oranges and apples, really excellent bacon, dry cereals, juices, plenty of coffee. And just down the street, almost within walking distance, is Hugo's, a great place for breakfast or lunch, with many healthy organic choices. The pool is clean, the rooms are quiet. Prices seem quite reasonable especially since breakfast is included. There's a PC in the lobby that's free for guests, although I believe the rooms have WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Quality”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Mikado Best Western hotel, had a very nice stay. Breakfast was good and the staff was very nice. We were in the middle of everything...

Reviews.Title: “Not kid friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mikado because of its location, which is very close to alot of the sites we wanted to visit. Right off the bat, we had trouble getting in our hotel room because the key only occassionally (and I mean occassionally) worked. I sent my niece (who's 18) and my two small children to the lobby to get sodas the first night we were there. When they came back to the room, they said there was a man outside hiding behind the bushes watching them. Less than a 1/2 hour later the guy working the desk that night shows up at our room saying we were slamming doors (hello! We couldn't even get in most the time, much less slam the doors) and had a dog. We do not have a dog and have not for several years. Then when I spoke with him about it, he claimed the kids were had lied to me! The rooms had very thin walls and you could hear everything (and I mean everything) going on outside, above your room, or next to it. While the rooms were clean and nicely decorated, I was not at all pleased with the rudeness directed at my children whenever they would speak with someone at the desk about getting a towel (which they were completely out of for the first day of our stay) or anything. If the adult goes up to the desk, he was just as nice and helpful with directions as could be. The hotel would be ok, if you do not have children along. I would not recommend it if you do. I tried to speak with the manager, but he apparently is only there once a day for about 15 minutes according to the employees. It was a shame, because the location was great for all the major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Big mistake!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to be close to relatives and because we thought we'd have easy access to the freeway. We didn't realize that easy access meant the freeway was only 30 yds away from our door! This hotel follows the standard motel format, with a strip of rooms stretched along the busiest freeway in L.A. (Rte 101). Glass louvers on the balcony did not close and we were unable (despite turning the AC on high) to drown out the roar of the freeway. One of the queen beds was missing a leg and balanced on 2 phone books. The first room offered to us reeked of smoke, even though it had a "non-smoking room" sign. The hotel did have a pool and a hot tub but we didn't try them because all we wanted was to move out after one night. Sorry, but this hotel has nothing to recommend it.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Mikado Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 12600 Riverside Drive, Los Angeles, CA 91607
